title: MNC E-sign testing - 1st Year intl MNC
custom_steps:
-E-sign button will be available on MNC in any states where the print button is also available, see: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3784672/MNC+Buttons+by+State|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3784672/MNC+Buttons+by+State|smart-link] 
-user must have EBIS-MNC-ESIGN individual perm (already added to boc approver in dev, can be added to individual club accounts as needed)
-workflow will follow the global e-sign workflow including player signature and club stamping of the MNC(documentation here: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3788242/EBIS4-SET-464+Use+Cases)|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3788242/EBIS4-SET-464+Use+Cases)]
-this should be tested at least once using the e-sign over email function(only once since there are limited licenses for email function)
-when issues are found comment the issue below including the MNC URL, also upload the PDF of the MNC with issues to this drive: [https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/folders/1Wcsd9nJ52fzECj80tePXRN18xALypftu|https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/folders/1Wcsd9nJ52fzECj80tePXRN18xALypftu] and reference the document by name in your comment
-this ticket should be used to track ALL issues found with 1st Year International MNCs

title: As a MNC Admin, I want ebis to have a help doc on the help page
custom_steps:
AC:
 - The MNC esign Help Doc (to be provided) will be available on the help page in ebis

title: As an MNC Admin, I want the esign button hidden in Preliminary
custom_steps:
AC:
 - When an MNC is in Preliminary state, there will be no esign present on the contract
 - Once the contract reaches Terms Submitted State, the esign button will appear

title: As a MNC Admin, I want an esign disclaimer to appear on esigned MNCs
custom_steps:
AC:
 - The following disclaimer will appear on every signature page in an MNC:
  -- English: "By providing my electronic signature and selecting the Submit button below, I accept these terms and conditions as if physically signed by me in writing."
  -- Spanish: "Al proporcionar mi firma electrÃ³nica y seleccionar "submit" abajo, acepto estos tÃ©rminos y condiciones como si hubiera firmado por escrito fÃ­sicamente."

custom_steps:
AC:
 - While esigning the Life Insurance Consent Form on a MNC, the "Check here if you do NOT wish to participate." will be an a checkbox

title: As an BOC MJC Admin user, I want a checkbox that will allow me to override adjusted salary calculations
custom_steps:
Wireframe: [https://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=info|https://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=info]

AC:

* BOC MJC Approver users will see a new â€˜Override Adjusted Salary Calculationsâ€™ checkbox on Major Contracts
* Clicking this box will make all adjusted salary fields editable in post approved contract states
* This checkbox will stop adjusted salary calcs from updating and allow users to enter the desired salary amounts manually

title: Figure out way to simulate/test Stats API
As a User, I want to see adjusted values for Payment Schedules
custom_steps:
Wireframe: [https://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=payment_scheduler|https://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=payment_scheduler]

AC:

* On MJC Payment Schedule modals, there will be a new Adjusted Principal Amount column
** This column will appear to the right of the Principal Amount column
* On MJC Payment Schedule modals, there will be a new Adjusted Payment Amount column
** This column will appear to the right of the Payment Amount column
* On MJC Payment Schedule modals, there will be a new Adj PV column
** This column will appear to the right of the LRD Present Value column
** Adj PV column will be read only

title: Optimize Stat Batch Logic
custom_steps:
Revisit Stat Batch logic and optimize where needed

Needs to be fixed: Setting the official flag for thresholds for previous years is not working if the threshold is not met.
Running the batch in â€œOfficialâ€� mode doesnâ€™t work; the official flag does not get set in the batch params.

title: As a Developer, I want to be able to recalculate all contracts which cover a specific year
custom_steps:
Create a batch which updates and saves contacts running through all calculations (LRD salaries and CBT/LRD payroll are the most important, but all calculations should be run).

AC:
* Batch recalculate all contracts with an MJC_COMP or MJC option year in the specified year in an async manner
* There is an optional ORG parameter
* Send the updated contracts to ebis link

title: As a User, I want to be able to search for players with a specific clause from the Contract Language widget
custom_steps:
Wire: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=contract_language_widget|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=contract_language_widget]

AC:

* On the Contract Language widget, there will be a new 'Contracts' column added to the end of the widget
* This column will display the number of contracts that contain the clause
* The number of contracts will be a hyper link
* Clicking the hyperlink will perform an advanced search and return the contracts that contain the clause
** ContractID will need to be added as a filter on Advance Search
* Users will be able to right-click and perform the search in a new tab/window
* Club users should only see Contracts they have permission to see
** Confirm Terms - MJ
** Terms Accepted - MN
** Completed - UEC

title: As a User, I want to search for contracts with a specific clause
custom_steps:
Data Discovery: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/408094628/Search+-+Contract+Language|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/408094628/Search+-+Contract+Language|smart-link] 

AC:

* There will be a Has Clause filter under the Contract Language search type
* The filter will match the provided data discovery
* This will be a dual field filter
** The first dropdown will be used to specify contract type (MJC, MNC, UEC)
** The 2nd field will be a drop down of clauses that is driven by the selection in the first dropdown
* Search result columns will match the data discovery

title: INC0120420 - New widget / updated Contract Language widget
custom_steps:
Received from: jeff.pfeifer@mlb.com
Recipients: ebissupport@mlb.com,Garrett.Horan@mlb.com,gina.liento@mlb.com,rreuter@lbisoftware.com,matthew.salvatore@mlb.com

Would like to expand this widget to include the following:

-          To be able to return a list of players whose contract (Major or Minor) contained or contains the selected clause.  It was suggested that there be an option next to each clause (a new column) that, when selected, will take the user to the Advance Search with the specific contract clause type filled and the expected results listed.  The column could be labeled (â€œShow Playersâ€�)

-          To add a row to each clause type that has a Club or Custom language version, and to be able to perform the same search described above on that selection as well

-          To add Minor League Miscellaneous to the list of options in the Clause type

title: As a User, I want some kind of indication that I'm about to merge a Clearinghouse profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe: [https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=player_merge|https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=player_merge]

AC:

* When performing a merge of two International Amateurs, the user will be notified on the merge modal if either of the profiles were created as part of the Clearinghouse program
** A profile will be considered a Clearinghouse profile if it has a Drug Test Request attached to it.
* If one of the profiles is a Clearinghouse profile, the following text will appear in red at the top of the modal:
** â€œWarning: You are attempting to merge a Clearinghouse profile.â€�
* There will be a new â€œClearinghouseâ€� row added to the merge modal
** It will appear between PlayerID and Last Name
* If either profile has a Drug Test Request attached to it, â€œYesâ€� will appear in the Clearinghouse row

title: As a User, I want to the Clearinghouse ebisID retained when merging
custom_steps:
AC:

* When performing a merge of intl amateur players, if one of the profiles is a Clearinghouse profile, the system will retain that ebisID when the merge is completed
** Currently, the logic is to keep the oldest ebisID
* Communication with LARI AID should not break as a results of one of these merges

custom_steps:
Weâ€™ve had this issue for a while.  Every time we need to add a country we need to made a code fix.   This should be controlled via database so that at the very least, we can change this with a data fix.

** District, Province, etc

** Format

custom_steps:
[https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3788182/Search+-+Investigations|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3788182/Search+-+Investigations|smart-link]

SNOW Ticket: [https://mlbam.service-now.com/nav_to.do?uri=%2Fincident.do%3Fsys_id%3D838e72fedb7c9010080e464e1396198a|https://mlbam.service-now.com/nav_to.do?uri=%2Fincident.do%3Fsys_id%3D838e72fedb7c9010080e464e1396198a]

Received from: [Ernesto.Hernandez@mlb.com|mailto:Ernesto.Hernandez@mlb.com]
Recipients: [ebissupport@mlb.com|mailto:ebissupport@mlb.com]

Hi EBIS team,

Our department is looking to enhance the information that appears when we search for Investigations under the â€œAdvanced Searchâ€� function. The attached report is the data we currently get.

We would like to add the following columns (all data that is currently in EBIS but not in this report):

1st Pro Signing Bonus
Home Province
Home City
Investigation Completed Date

Including these columns will make the analyses we do on Investigations much more efficient.

If you have any questions, please let me know.

Thanks.

Ernesto.

title: INC0146970 - Updated CBT/LRD Cash Accounting For Payroll Reports
custom_steps:
In order to account for adjustments made to the cash transactions which affect CBT and LRD payrolls we will add an additional collapsible section to the outright trade transaction called â€œCash Payroll Allocationsâ€�.  The values that display in this section should match up with the values that are displaying on the payrolls in the cash transaction section.

AC:   

* There will be a new â€œCash Payroll Allocationsâ€� collapsible section on outright trades
* The section will display two lists, one for CBT and one for LRD payments
* Each list will have the following columns:
** Payor Org
** Payee Org
** Payment year
** Payment amount
** garbage can for deleting payment (edit mode only)
* There will be an â€˜addâ€™ button below each list that adds a new, blank row to the list
* The section should only be editable by users with a new permission â€œEBIS-TX-PAYROLL-CASH-EDITORSâ€�
* Prior to approval, the section is not visible
* Once the transaction is approved, the section is visible and changes can be made
* Updates made to the payments should be reflected on the associated payroll (CBT or LRD) when run for an as of date
* When saving a payroll, any updates on the transaction should be reflected in the cash transactions sections

Cameronâ€™s original email:

Hey Guys-

I wanted to flag an item for discussion after we return from arbitration. As more Clubsâ€™ payrolls have been proximate to the CBT threshold, we would like to revisit the way we account for cash on the Payrolls reports when it is run â€œas ofâ€� a certain date. Right now, my understanding is that EBIS has some fairly convoluted back-end logic to calculate the CBT allocations on multi-year cash transactions, and thereâ€™s not really any way we can update the resulting calculations.

What I would like to do, if possible, is apply that same logic to an additional feature on each Outright (Trade) page. What Iâ€™m envisioning, on the Mookie Betts trade as an example, would be an additional collapsible section titled â€œCash Payroll Allocationsâ€� for trades that include cash considerations. This section would have the same back-end logic that EBIS has now, except only BOC users could adjust the yearly allocations. When running payrolls â€œas ofâ€� a certain date, the cash would pull from the allocations assigned to each trade page rather than the back-end logic. Basically, it would give us the ability to make manual adjustments to cash, which many Clubs have requested.

Let me know if thereâ€™s a good time in early March to discuss this new feature, and I can put together a more robust description of the desired functionality in the interim.

Thanks,
Cameron
